venue.name: Northeastern University - West Village F Building

item.description:
Join other Latino movie lovers at the 12th Annual Boston Latino International Film Festival! Friday's festival will include 3 different movie programs.  Check out www.bliff.org for more film schedules and to watch the movie trailers!

--------------------------------------------

6.00 p.m. Cuban Shorts Program

Uvero / Arian Enrique Pernas / 11min

Easy Sailing / Hanny Marin / 7min

Usufructo / Eliecer Jimenez / 10min

Al final del camino / Diddier Santos & Yaima Pardo / 31min / Doc


--------------------------------------------

7.15 p.m. Flamenco Program

Mexico Flamenco / Spain-Mexico / Josep Badell & Carlos Snachez-Llibre / 2012 / 53min / Documentary
A Social documentary that brings alive the gypsy cultures Jarocha and shows how it inspires and generates projects and vision for today’s youth.

Co-Presented by:  FLAMENCO DANCE PROJECT

--------------------------------------------

8:30 p.m. Spanish Shorts Program

A Story for the Modlins / Sergio Oksman / 26min
After appearing in the film Rosemary’s Baby, by Roman Polanski, Elmer Modlin ran away with his family to a distant land, where they shut themselves inside a dark apartment for thirty years.

That Wasn’t Me / Esteban Crespo / 23min
“Being a soldier is not difficult: either you get used to it or they kill you. The hardest thing is getting used to living with your memories and being yourself again after doing what you have done”

The Birth / Xavi Sala / 14min
A sterile worker who wishes to have a child must assist a young woman in labor who does not want to have the baby.

The Wedding / Marina Seresesky / 12min
Mirta is from Cuba and she lives in Madrid. Like many other inmigrants she works cleaning. Today at 6 pm, her daughter gets married. But nothing goes as she planned. To arrive at that wedding will be more difficult than expected.

What the eye doesn’t see / Natalia Mateo / 15min
On Christmas Eve you have to have fun, because SANTA CLAUS is on his way, because there are children. But on this night secrets are opened and lies are floating in the atmosphere. However, who cares about one more little lie, it will be the last.

Prologue / Lucas Figueroa / 8min
98.9 % of the population is not aware of the fact that our lives could turn 180º in three seconds… at any time.

.Sub / Jossie Malis Alvarez / 15min
An African immigrant with communication problems faces the bureaucratic difficulties of a strange society in original version.

Zombi / David Moreno / 12min
If you have no memory, a blank gaze, you’ve forgotten how to talk.. You’re a zombie, right?

--------------------------------------
item.how_to_find_us: Directly across the Ruggles Station [Orange Line] and minutes from the Northeastern Stop [Green Line]. This building is located right next to the O’Bryant Center.

group.name: The Boston Spanish Language Meetup Group

item.name: Boston Latino International Film Festival
